result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua N Hadley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • MA-Fail/Notify Circumstances [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.91(2)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Court has set a Probation Review Hearing for 10/10/16 at 3:00 PM.

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution joint and several with Melissa Hadley plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Maintain full-time employment as determined by Dept. of Corrections.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: Stayed. To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.
To perform 100 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

records.addlTxt: 03:13 PM Defendant Joshua N Hadley via Zoom.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DOC Agent Katrina Meyer appears via Zoom.  Carol Wautlet of DCHS appears via Zoom.  Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed.  Agent Meyer requests more time for defendant to complete community service as defendant has had some limitations because of medical issue.  Defendant has been making his regular monthly payment.  Defendant advises he's doing everything he's supposed to.  Court encourages defendant defendant to continue with the good progress.  Court won't set another PRH, agent Meyer can request hearing if she feels one is needed.

03:19 PM Defendant Joshua N Hadley in court.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions Agent Katrina Meyer on how defendant is doing on probation.  Agent Meyer indicates defendant has been making payments as ordered.  Defendant is working on his community service, is putting forth the effort to work on his community service.  Defendant is currently working at The Dollar Store.  Court sets another PRH to see where defendant is at with the community service.  Probation review hearing scheduled for April 13, 2020 at 03:00 pm.
Subpoena and Proof of Service Agent Katrina Meyer
Subpoena and Proof of Service Tara Feurig
Subpoena and Proof of Service Tim Greil

Defendants supervision is extended for a period of 3 years from 4/18/19 to 4/18/22 in order for completion of community service hours.  Supervision can discharge during this time once community service hours and financial obligations have been met.
from DOC Agent Tim Greil re: extension of defendants probation
and stipulation to waive appearance and hearing

08:30 AM Defendant Joshua N Hadley in court.  Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DOC Agent Tim Greil present in court.  Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed.  Court questions defendant on his current employment, payment of restitution and community service.  Defendant working several part-time jobs, tries to pay $20 per week toward restitution, is looking to complete his community service with a church in town this spring.  Atty Greil indicates defendant's probation will be extended with hopes of setting a higher monthly payment.  State concerned that defendant has only done minimal community service in the last 3 years and only paid about $500 toward restitution. Court orders defendant to pay $100 per month toward restitution, advises defendant he needs to complete his community service hours.  Agent Greil can request hearing be removed from the calendar if defendant is making regular monthly payments by next hearing.  Probation review hearing scheduled for October 28, 2019 at 03:00 pm.
Subpoena and Proof of Service Tim Greil
Probation review hearing on February 4, 2019 at 08:30 am.
Request for Probation Review Hearing.          Sheryl:  Set for probation review hearing ASAP. DTE

Defendant Joshua N Hadley in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent Tammy Walls present in court. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. Court questions agent on how defendant is doing on probation. Agent indicates defendant is cooperating with probation and making payments toward is financial obligations. Defendant indicates he got a better paying job at the Landmark.  Court won't set another probation review hearing, agent can request hearing if she feels one is needed. Court commends defendant on the good job he's doing on probation.

Defendant Joshua N Hadley in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. Carol Wautlet of MA program makes statement. State/Defense give joint sentencing recommendation. Defendant makes statement to the court. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: for DNA Sample

Defendant Joshua N Hadley in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 2.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 2. Court dismisses Ct. 1 but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. Defense asks court to set off sentencing for 30 days. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Joshua N Hadley in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State withdraws their motion to join trial with co-defendant. Atty Malcore feels optimistic that matters may resolve, requests a status in March. State has no objection to adjournment. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
from Rose Wodack on defendants behalf.

Defendant Joshua N Hadley in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Malcore indicates matter is not resolved, asks court to set case for trial and have newer file continue to track along. State would like to have case joined with co-defendant for trial. Atty Malcore objects to joining the cases. Court set motion hearing with all parties involved, including co-defendant. Bond remains in effect.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Joshua N Hadley in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Malcore requests a status date to allow her to review discovery and try to work out global resolution on both pending matters. Discussion regarding joint trial with co-defendant. Court needs to hear from Atty Malcore by the end of January as to whether matter should be set for trial or not.   Bond remains as is.  Status conference scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 8/31/15. (fingerprint card destroyed 4/21/16)
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Court will address motion to join defendants case together will be decided at a later date.  Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Joshua N Hadley in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Motion and Proposed Order to Seal Original Criminal Complaint. Court seals original criminal complaint filed 7/29/15.
To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Joshua N Hadley in court with attorney Sarah Sonia Malcore.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit prelim. Bond set. Court won't address State's motion to join co-defendants today, will wait until case is a little further along.  Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
